intro: Trigonella pseudocapitata, commonly known as the false melilote, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, branched stems that grow up to 30 cm in height, often with a hairy texture. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in the spring. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with several pairs of oval, serrated leaflets. Trigonella pseudocapitata is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in dry, sunny environments.
